trans-unit.source: Provides an interface for access to the visual representation and content of a control at design time.
This interface is intended for use by design host developers.
Gets the designer region that contains the associated control, if any.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> object if the associated control is contained in a designer region; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Retrieves the outer bounds of the designer view.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> for which you want to retrieve the bounds.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> containing information about the location and measurements of the view at design time.
Notifies the design host that the area represented by the provided rectangle needs to be repainted on the design surface.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> representing the location and outer measurements of the view on the design surface.
The coordinate-system origin for this rectangle is the top-left corner of the element to which the behavior is attached.
Gets the designer component for the naming container of the associated control, if any.
An IDesigner object representing the designer component for the naming container for the associated control; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
For a description of this member, see SetFlags.
A member of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.ViewFlags"></xref> enumeration.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to set the flag, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to cancel the flag.
Puts the provided content into the provided designer region.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> into which the content is to be put.
The HTML markup to be put into the designer region.
Gets a value indicating whether designer regions are supported.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if designer regions are supported; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Causes the associated control to redraw the invalidated regions within its client area.
An event raised by the design host for the view and designer component.

The ViewEvent is raised by the design host if any of the following occur: - The user clicks on the view in the design host, - The design host repaints the client region on the design surface, - The user has elected to change the editing mode of an editable region corresponding to a template.
To be added.
